activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9878
activity.text:
@amjithtitus09 

1. I enabled `noUncheckedIndexedAccess` in tsconfig.json fileafter enabling it. It shows the errors found in the following list of files and i have done one change in one of the file before and after

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/be0d2056-4190-4b0c-aba2-48d4b4c98232)


![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4100f3b6-2a28-4a7c-8fd2-dcf1926c6ef4)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9878
activity.text:
Hi @amjithtitus09 
Enabled noUncheckedIndexedAccess in tsconfig.json to enforce stricter checks on indexed access.

Changes:

Added "noUncheckedIndexedAccess": true to compilerOptions.
Updated array/object access with null/undefined checks, type assertions, optional chaining, and default values where necessary.
Estimated resolution time for errors: 2–3 hours (including fixes and testing).

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8963
activity.text:
Hey @nihal467 
I replaced all instances of cy.wait() with cy.intercept() and dynamic waits.

However, the following issues arise when certain cy.wait() statements are removed:

In FacilityHomepage.cy.ts, removing cy.wait(2000) at line 177 causes the test case to fail because the logged-in nurse cannot see the notify message on the noticeboard. Additionally, intercepts are already included, so there is no possibility of using additional intercept here.

In PatientRegistration.tsx, removing cy.wait(3000) at line 158 results in a test case failure, indicating that after selecting the gender as "Female," the "Is antenatal?" checkbox is not displayed. No intercept is triggered when the gender selection is clicked.

In patientFileUpload.ts, removing cy.wait(2000) at line 30 within the verifyUploadFilePresence function causes the "User-level Based Permission for File Modification" test case to fail, while other test cases pass. I attempted to include intercepts, but the issue persists at the same point.

Could you please look into this?

activity.text: Hey @rithviknishad, the tooltip is now working fine on both mobile and desktop. I have added a click event in `FacilityCard` for mobile view and removed `onMouseEnter` and `onMouseLeave` as they are not needed. Even without them, the tooltip works perfectly on mobile using the `onClick` event. Could you please review it?
